fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend
Class BuilderSubIndexProviderSolutionImpl

java.lang.Object
  fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.BuilderSubIndexProviderSolutionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Builder<SubIndexProviderSolution>, BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
 class BuilderSubIndexProviderSolutionImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution

Standard implementation of BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution. Another implementation can be created by implementing BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution.

Author:
Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur

Constructor Detail

BuilderSubIndexProviderSolutionImpl

public BuilderSubIndexProviderSolutionImpl()
Constructs a standard builder for a SubIndexProviderSolution. Initializes all the builder's parameters to null and the _complete field to false.

Description copied from interface: BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
Sets the reaction rule's fields parameter to build the sub index provider. These fields are the reactives needed by the reaction rule. Basically, these are the attributes of the reaction rule class, without the ones annotated Dontreact.

setParamType

public void setParamType(java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType paramType)
Description copied from interface: BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
Sets the parameterized type parameter to build the sub index provider. This type is the parameterized type of a SubSolution object. This SubSolution object is an attribute of the reaction rule given to the builder. This class is used to go down in the inner solutions of the reaction rule's main solution. See SubSolutionReactivesAccessor.

Specified by:
setParamType in interface BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
Parameters:
paramType - The parameterized type of a SubSolution object attribute of the specified reaction rule.
See Also:
SubSolution, SubSolutionReactivesAccessor

setSolution

public void setSolution(Solution sol)
Description copied from interface: BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
Sets the solution parameter to build the sub index provider. The specified solution is the solution in which the sub index provider has to rely to provide indexes on the reactives asked by the reaction rule parameter.

Specified by:

build

public void build()
           throws ChemicalException
Processes to the building of the index provider. This functions first checks if the solution and reaction rule parameters are instantiated, if not a ChemicalException explaining the issue is thrown.
Depending on the other parameters instanciation, this function will then call a root build (see rootBuild()) or a recursive build (recursiveBuild()). Root build is used only once, for the root SubIndexProviderSolution of the IndexProvider object, then the recursive function is always called (see IndexProvider structure). At the end, the product is declared as complete (_complete is set to true).
Note: the implementation used to build every SubIndexProviderSolution is the standard implementation.

Specified by:
build in interface Builder<SubIndexProviderSolution>
Throws:
ChemicalException
See Also:
IndexProvider, SubIndexProviderSolution, BuilderIndexProvider

recursiveBuild

private void recursiveBuild()
                     throws ChemicalException
This building version needs the following parameters to be correctly instantiated : solution, reaction rule, parameterized type, SubSolution field of the reaction rule. If at least one of these parameters is not instantiated, a ChemicalException is thrown. Depending on the parameterized type ( SubSolution or SubSolutionElements ) the processing differs. In the first case, a recursion is done in order to reach the desired solution overlapping level; in the second this precise overlapping level is reached, the recursion ends and a SubIndexProviderElement is created for each desired reactive given in the type list (see SubSolutionReactivesAccessor an the SubSolutionElements type list field).

Throws:
ChemicalException

rootBuild

private void rootBuild()
                throws ChemicalException
Builds a root SubIndexProviderSolution for a IndexProvider, normally called only once.
This building version needs the following parameters to be correctly instantiated : solution, reaction rule and reaction rule's fields. If at least one of these parameters is not instantiated, a ChemicalException is thrown.
This function basically goes through the reaction rule (given in parameter of the builder) and for each field/reactive, it creates a SubIndexProviderSolution (if the field is a SubSolution object) or a SubIndexProviderElement (if the field is a simple java object). All sub SubIndexProviderSolution will be built with the recursiveBuild() function.

Throws:
ChemicalException
See Also:
IndexProvider, BuilderIndexProvider

buildDependantIndexesListWithFields

private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> buildDependantIndexesListWithFields(java.lang.reflect.Field[] rrFields,
                                                                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> mapElements)
                                                                                       throws ChemicalException
Builds the list of dependent indexes for a the specified reaction rule fields. Basically two indexes are dependent if they correspond to reactives that have the same type. And when two indexes are dependent, their HAVE to be different in the index provider, else that would mean a solution element is selected twice for the same reaction This function builds a list containing list of integers; a sub-list represents a set of dependent indexes, and there can be several sets of dependent indexes.

Parameters:
rrFields - The reaction rule fields (that do not specify the Dontreact annotation).
mapElements - The solution elements.
Returns:
The list of sets of dependent indexes.
Throws:
ChemicalException

buildDependantIndexesListWithTypes

private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> buildDependantIndexesListWithTypes(java.util.List<java.lang.String> typeList,
                                                                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> mapElements)
                                                                                      throws ChemicalException
Builds the list of dependent indexes for the specified list of reactive type. Basically two indexes are dependent if they correspond to reactives that have the same type. And when two indexes are dependent, their HAVE to be different in the index provider, else that would mean a solution element is selected twice for the same reaction. This function builds a list containing list of integers; a sub-list represents a set of dependent indexes, and there can be several sets of dependent indexes.

Parameters:
typeList - The list of reactive type.
mapElements - The solution elements.
Returns:
The list of sets of dependent indexes.
Throws:
ChemicalException
